@PhenomSF’s team @BX3EK have joined forces with @ValerengaOslo - esports and sports converging again. Would love to see some best practices from sports marketing applied here - haven’t seen that thus far with these kind of partnerships. https://t.co/d8A8aiOsTF
Smart on League’s side - guaranteed promotion of content and players, perhaps introducing the younger demographic to the sport in an attempt to engage them before natural drop off. Clever.

@ManhuntSeries Unabomber is superb. One of the best crafted pieces of content I’ve seen in years. Beautifully shot and directed. Bettany and Worthington fantastic. Watch it people.
My quick maths on the Riot deal put it at around $50k per hour broadcast. And that includes the tech piece. And isn’t exclusive across linear.
323 hrs per season. 2 seasons, around 646hrs give or take. $139k per hour fee.
Preseason (12 matches) - 12hrs Regular (4 stages of 5 weeks each) - 300hrs Playoffs/Finals (assuming 8 teams and 90 mins broadcast for each match) - 11ish hours
My US friends may miss this meme reference, but some quick maths for that @overwatchleague fee. Assumption that 1 match = 1 hour https://t.co/eMgbePj54K
👇 https://t.co/UznEbOVHXM

OR, the wording is clever. Perhaps linear can pick up regular season or playoffs but not both. Ambiguously worded.

OR, perhaps this is why the revenue share payments are reportedly not kicking in until Season 3, when they can sell linear rights. Either way, at least it’s readily available - would’ve been a travesty to league start otherwise.
In other news, the sun rose. You’ve got to wonder why linear broadcasters haven’t jumped at the chance to pick it up, or perhaps it was never pitched. https://t.co/h1Df9fLlp3
